greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the binary weights of the lengths of 1-runs in base-2 representation of n: a(n) = A000523(A286575(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65536
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(n) = A000523(A286575(n)). [Log_2 of run-length transform of A001316.]
example: For n = 27, "11011" in binary, there are two 1-runs, both of length 2, thus a(27) = A000120(2) + A000120(2) = 1 + 1 = 2.
For n = 29, "11101" in binary, there are two 1-runs, of lengths 1 and 3, thus a(29) = A000120(1) + A000120(3) = 1 + 2 = 3.
For n = 61, "111101" in binary, there are two 1-runs, of lengths 1 and 4, thus a(61) = A000120(1) + A000120(4) = 1 + 1 = 2.
program: from sympy import factorint, prime, log
def b(n): return n + 1 if n<2 else prime(1 + (len(bin(n)[2:]) - bin(n)[2:].count("1"))) * b(A(n))
def a(n): return int(math.floor(log(a286575(n), 2))) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 30 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 28 2017
